text: On tap from Hanks Oyster Bar. Pure smoked malts with a strain of lager hops. Finish is clean.

On tap at Scion in Silver Spring, MD. 

Clear, straw-yellow with a small near white head and good lacing. 

Aroma of citrus, smoked meat, grain and pale malt. 

Taste of smoke, pale malt, sweet light fruit and citrus. 

Medium body and medium carbonation with a smooth mouthfeel. 

The smoke flavor, while obvious, is far from overwhelming. Indeed, it is virtually nicely balanced by sweet malts and a touch of citrus. Definitely no "lick the ash tray" feeling from this rauchbier. Very nicely done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft - pours yellow white head - nose/taste of smoked burnt wood, smoke meat, smoked lemon - medium body

Threes, Brooklyn tap: pours gold with a white head. Aroma is burnt wood, meat, smoke blah. Taste is smoky. A little sugary but not too sweet. Somewhat peppery at the finish. Interesting but not great.

On tap at the Shaw brewpub. Pours a near clear yellow gold with a white head that dissipates slowly to the edges and laces slightly. Aroma has a nice light smoke with sweet grains and a touch of bacon. Flavor has the same nice smooth smoke note with sweet grains and a bit of bread supporting.

The smoke manifests as peat, brine, minerals, smoldering fire pit, with mild trace of honey-ham meatiness. Medium bodied, semi-sweet, lightly salty / brine-y, savory malt texture with velvet fine carbonation, finishing with lip-smacking sweetness and quenching and salivating mild acidity.

Pours dark orange/copperish. Aroma: nice smoke aroma, malt, some cherry, earth. Taste: very well balanced, including a clear smoke domination but also elements of a proper pale ale, such as maltiness. Well done.

On tap at R.F.D in DC. Nice subtle smoked elements to this pale beer. Light, hazy golden pour. Malts in the nose, more smoke/ashy taste comes out in the flavor. While not a full blown rauch, this would be a great gateway to the style.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 Draft. Pale, unpromising yellow. No lace. Aroma of cherry wood, which is one of the two woods that rauched this bier. Flavors start with a tart, sweet spritz of kiwi, followed by some chewy, high register smoke and some faint sweet orange. Absolutely terrific.
4oz draft at Right Proper-Brookland. Lite copper with bare head. Noble hops, smoked malt, grains, wood. Decent.

Wooooo this is a beer, and grouping it with gose seems completely wrong. This is just straight up smokey in the nose with hints of corn sweetness on the front palate and lingering wispy smoke. Great stuff.
On tap at the brewpub. Really hits the spot. Satisfying, flavourful, smoke , hops. Tiny sour finish.So drinkable.

2-4 oz draft pour at SAVOR 2015s Saturday night session. Hazy straw yellow with off-white head. Aromas of light smoke, stone fruit. Tastes of smoke, stone fruit, smoky wood. Medium-light body with a dry finish. Interesting and tasty.
Draft. Pours hazy gold with a white head. Smoked pale malts, mild grainy notes, lower sweetness, and a nice dry finish. Good stuff; love it.

Tap at the brewery. Pours cloudy yellow with a large, creamy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is smoked wheat malt, light earthy and spicy hops with light pineapple notes. Flavor is lightly smoked malt, medium earthy and spicy hops with a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.

Tap. Pours clear golden pale amber, medium off-white head, dissipates fairly slowly, some lacing. Aroma is smoky, campfire notes for sure. Flavor is dry, a very light funk underneath a medium wood smoked flavor. Light body. Quite a nice refreshing beer, but a bit of a one-note wonder.
Hazy gold pour with a white head of foam. The aroma hazy musty, earthy qualities with some salt. The taste is a little earthy and sweet. Medium body. Medium to high carbonation.

16oz pint at the brewery pours a very murky straw gold with some sticky, clumpy, lacing white head. Nose has mild hints of smoke, like smoldering grass, lemon, some mineral water, straw. Flavor follows along, some mild honey, straw, a little wheaty, hints of smoke, some mild brininess, a little raw yeast. Clean finish.

Light colored pour with a small off-white head. Aroma was light smoke notes - nothing overpowering thankfully - some malt character. Flavor was a touch of smoked grain, balanced out pretty well with a light sweetness. Went well with dinner.

tap at the brewery and this one is fine. soft toasted light doughy forest floor malt backing. bit of jerky, woody smoke, bit of campfire. lotta flavor @ lower boost. smoke character is fine. moderate dryness. pretty drinkable.
Tap, DC, golden pour, white head, smoky aroma, taste is smoky, some bacon, very nice.

Location: Draft at Right Proper, 5/24/14


Aroma: The aroma has some smoked malts/smoked meat, grains, and some citrus 

Appearance: Pours a cloudy, pale, yellowish color with a small, fizzy white head

Flavor: The flavor is much the same, with a nice mix of smokey flavors to go with the grains

Palate: The body is light-medium, it has an above average carbonation, and a smokey finish

Overall Impression: 
I thought this was a really nice example of the style. Well-made stuff and very enjoyable. Another impressive beer from Right Proper. Id happily drink this again.

Draft. Medium white head atop hazy straw body. Aroma is medium sweet, smoked malt, light sourness. Taste is moderately sweet, bread, some smoked grain, light sourness. Light body, light effervescence, nicely drinkable.

[ Keg ][ 16oz ][ Right Proper ][ $6 ][ Flared Pint ][ 6.1.14 ]
>> Low haze, bright straw pour with beautiful, wispy lacing. Nose is lightly smoked, soft bacon, orange peel, flowers. Taste is juicy and bright citrus, big bacon, fatty, perfectly done for style. Absolutely delicious. High carbonation, refreshing, and smoked but not heavy or meaty/dense. Near perfect. Loved.

Location/Date:Draft at Rigth Proper, 5/24/2014.
Appearance:Pours a yellow cloud.
Aroma: Aroma of smoke, wheat, lemon.
Taste: Similar to nose. Smoke but not overbearing, wheat and lemon.
Palate:Light body.
Summary: My first Right Proper beer! Im a big fan of anything rauch(besides actual smoke in the air), really enjoyed this.
Pours golden with some head and lacing. Bitter and smokey. Some sense of malt and hops, lots of campfire for sure but smoke dominates. Tap at brewpub.

Draft at the source. Hazy to cloudy yellow color, small white head. Aroma of charred straw, light smoke, distant burning pig. Taste is straw, hay on a background of campfire. Very tasty, and the smoke is not over the top.
